sentences.sContent: The party was small and select.
sentences.sCn: 团里人员不多，都是经过精心挑选的。

sentences.sContent: Honorary degrees are handed out to a select few .
sentences.sCn: 荣誉学位颁给挑选出的少数几个人。

sentences.sContent: ...You are required to select one word for each blank from a list...

...A study in one Texas school district compared the lunches of fourth graders who did not have food choices with those of fifth graders who could choose either a standard lunch or select from a snack-bar...
...You are required to select one word for each blank from a list of choices given in a word bank following the passage...
...Perhaps they prefer going into a nursing home and can select one in advance...

synos.tran: 精选的；挑选出来的；极好的

phrases.pCn: 特别委员会（为某一特案组成的）

remMethod.val: se ＋ lect(选择) → 选择， 挑选

trans.tranCn: 精选的， 挑选出来的； 优等的， 第一流的
trans.tranOther: a select group of people or things is a small special group that has been chosen carefully
to choose something or someone by thinking carefully about which is the best, most suitable etc
